Umpqua Dairy considers the RMP/PSM Program a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Umpqua Dairy employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP/PSM Program Umpqua Dairy will continue to maintain overall plant worker, public, and environmental safety.

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Umpqua Dairy has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. Nevertheless, Umpqua Dairy continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP/PSM Program. This has improved Umpqua Dairys ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP/PSM related events so that Umpqua Dairys management team can ensure that the RMP/PSM Program is being implemented.

Umpqua Dairy has implemented all aspects of the RMP/PSM Program. When a RMP/PSM Program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.
In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Umpqua Dairy has also entered into a contract with Resource Complianc

and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Umpqua Dairy Products is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.
Umpqua Dairy has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Umpqua Dairy facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Umpqua Dairy has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

The RMP/PSM Program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Umpqua Dairy Products operates a food processing facility for ice cream, milk, and other dairy products in Roseburg, OR. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:

(13) Silos
(8) Tanks (21-28 in the Mix Room)
(3) Ice Cream Freezers
(1) Ice Cream Hardener
(1) Cooler
(1) Box Frozen Room
(1) Storage Freezer
(2) Sweet Water Tanks / Ice Builders
(1) Production Room
(1) Cheese Room
(1) Curd Rinse Water Chiller
(1) Glycol Chiller

1.2.2 Facility Location

Umpqua Dairy Products is located at 333 SE Sykes St, Roseburg, OR 97470. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receiver is 43.204186, -123.353874. The facility is located approximately 1/4 mile east of Interstate 5 and ? mile east of the South Umpqua River in a residential area surrounded primarily by single family homes.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard, although it should be acknowledged that a special flood hazard area is located ? mile east of the facility. 

A review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Umpqua Dairy Products had a <1% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

The ammonia refrigeration evaporators at Umpqua Dairy Products use a variety of flooded, pumped overfeed, and direct expansion (DX) configurations. Similarly, control valve groups are located throughout the plant: inside (near evaporators), on the roof (above evaporators), and outside (adjacent to evaporators). The vessels and compressors which serve the entire system are located

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP)  Title 40 CFR §68
Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program  Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP/PSM Program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Umpqua Dairy Products Co. has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP/PSM related activities. 

1.1 Umpqua Dairy, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Umpqua Dairy has updated their unified RMP/PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which has the presence of a hazardous chemical above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                   | Process Chemical                | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration  Anhydrous Ammonia            13,000

Our RMP/PSM Program promotes overall plant, worker, public, and environmental safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have acce
